comments.body: I don't think so, no.  For one, if we did, then `kafka.network.Processor` would have to be able to get to the `Authenticator` instance, and currently `KafkaChannel` does not expose that publicly.  The guts of this method also refers to state within `KafkaChannel` as well (specifically, `lastReauthenticationStartNanos`), and while we could pass that in instead, fundamentally the `KafkaChannel` instance also has to swap out its `Authenticator` instances.  So I think this method really has to belong in `KafkaChannel`.
Similar to above: I don't think so, no, for the same reasons.

There are so many methods in KafkaChannel that simply call a method in `authenticator`. I wonder if it would be better to add an `authenticator()` method and let callers directly use `authenticator`, reducing the amount of code in `KafkaChannel`.

Not sure.  My gut says the benefit would be minimal and the downside to exposing the `Authenticator` (adding complexity to code that now simply asks the `KafkaChannel` to do stuff) would outweigh any benefit, but regardless, if you decide it is something you would like to do maybe it can be addressed as a separate ticket?
Yes, let's leave it as is for now.
